com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils

Class FutureUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils.FutureUtils

  • public class FutureUtils
extends Object
    Utilities relating to the specific use of futures within Aleph2 Contains code fragments from http://onoffswitch.net/converting-akka-scala-futures-java-futures/
    Author:
    acp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  FutureUtils.FromScalaFuture<T>
      Code adapted from http://onoffswitch.net/converting-akka-scala-futures-java-futures/
      static class  FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T>
      A wrapper for a future that enables decoration with a management side channel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FutureUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> createManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<T> base_future)
      Creates a trivial management future with no side channel - ie equivalent to the input future itself
      static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> createManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<T> base_future, CompletableFuture<Collection<BasicMessageBean>> secondary_results)
      Creates a trivial management future with the specified side channel - the future interface describes the primary action, the future returned by getManagementResults describes secondary results generated by actions spawned by the primary actions
      static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> denestManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T>> nested_mgmt_future)
      De-nests a completablefuture back into a management future
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> efficientWrap(scala.concurrent.Future<? extends Object> f, scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext execution_context)
      Wraps a scala Future in a completable future efficiently using the underlying scala infrastructure For Akka (where a ActorSystem.dispatcher() is available as the execution context), should use AkkaFutureUtils.efficientWrap instead Code adapted from http://onoffswitch.net/converting-akka-scala-futures-java-futures/ TODO: do not use this code as it has not yet been tested
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> returnError(Exception e)
      Generates a future that will error as soon as it's touched
      static <T> CompletableFuture<T> simpleWrap(scala.concurrent.Future<Object> f)
      Wraps a scala Future in a completable future very simply using a spare thread from the general executor pool For Akka futures, now AkkaFutureUtils.efficientWrap should be used - for general scala, ideally FutureUtils.efficientWrap should be used though this has not been tested.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • simpleWrap

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> simpleWrap(scala.concurrent.Future<Object> f)
        Wraps a scala Future in a completable future very simply using a spare thread from the general executor pool For Akka futures, now AkkaFutureUtils.efficientWrap should be used - for general scala, ideally FutureUtils.efficientWrap should be used though this has not been tested.
        Parameters:
        f - the scala Future
        Returns:
        the CompletableFuture

      • efficientWrap

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> efficientWrap(scala.concurrent.Future<? extends Object> f,
                                                     scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext execution_context)
        Wraps a scala Future in a completable future efficiently using the underlying scala infrastructure For Akka (where a ActorSystem.dispatcher() is available as the execution context), should use AkkaFutureUtils.efficientWrap instead Code adapted from http://onoffswitch.net/converting-akka-scala-futures-java-futures/ TODO: do not use this code as it has not yet been tested
        Parameters:
        f - the scala Future
        execution_context - - the scala execution context within which this should be run (if one is not available, use simpleWrap instead)
        Returns:
        the CompletableFuture

      • createManagementFuture

        public static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> createManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<T> base_future)
        Creates a trivial management future with no side channel - ie equivalent to the input future itself
        Returns:
        the management future (just containing the base future)

      • createManagementFuture

        public static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> createManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<T> base_future,
                                                                         CompletableFuture<Collection<BasicMessageBean>> secondary_results)
        Creates a trivial management future with the specified side channel - the future interface describes the primary action, the future returned by getManagementResults describes secondary results generated by actions spawned by the primary actions
        Returns:
        the management future (just containing the base future)

      • denestManagementFuture

        public static <T> FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T> denestManagementFuture(CompletableFuture<FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<T>> nested_mgmt_future)
        De-nests a completablefuture back into a management future
        Returns:
        the de-nested management future

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> returnError(Exception e)
        Generates a future that will error as soon as it's touched
        Parameters:
        e - - the underlying exception
        Returns:
        a future that errors when touched
